data.text:
We cordially invite you to the 15th LutherConference and the award ceremony of the LutherRose 2022 of the Internationale Martin Luther Stiftung. The event will take place on 11. November from 15:00 at the Hoflaankerk in Rotterdam.

Theme

On this year’s theme “Free trade and free will? Erasmus, Luther and the current economic challenges”, prominent figures from the worlds of business and politics will discuss the topic in a panel discussion. The panel includes: Economist Prof. Dr. Lans Bovenberg, the parliamentary group leader of the Reformed Political Party SGP Kees van der Staaij, lawyer Christian Treumann and entrepreneurs Gert-Jan Huisman and Marti Pluygers. Otto Fricke, Chairman of the German-Dutch Parliamentary Group, will open the discussion with a keynote speech.

Award Ceremony LutherRose 2022

In the following award ceremony the LutherRose 2022 for social responsibility and entrepreneurial courage will be awarded to the Executive Vice-President of the European Union and Commissioner for Competition Margrethe Vestager.

With the award of the LutherRose for social responsibility and entrepreneurial courage the Internationale Martin Luther Stiftung honours individuals from the world of business, who through their private life and professional activities have used the reformatory traditions of freedom and responsibility for the common good.

Copenhagen’s Bishop Peter Skov-Jakobsen will give the laudatory speech for the awardee. We are also looking forward to the socio-economic observations of former Dutch Prime Minister Prof. Dr. Jan Peter Balkenende.

Date and Time

Friday, 11th November 2022

LutherConference: 3.00 p.m.

LutherRose award ceremony: 6.00 p.m.

Venue

Hoflaankerk

Oudedijk 2

3062 AE Rotterdam, Netherlands

Registration

More

The International Martin Luther Foundation is hosting the event in collaboration with the Erasmus Economics & Theology Institute and REFORC.

Language of the conference will be English.
